channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Eighteen killed in New Delhi station crush
item.description: Eyewitnesses tell the BBC a "huge crowd" had gathered at the Indian capital's central train station.

item.title: Justice Department fires 20 immigration judges from backlogged courts amid major government cuts
Amazon workers vote against unionizing a North Carolina warehouse
item.description: Workers voted against joining a grassroots union called Carolina Amazonians United for Solidarity and Empowerment, or CAUSE.

item.title: Eastern U.S. endures flooding with snow forecast to hit Northeast
item.description: Water submerged cars and buildings in Kentucky and mudslides blocked roads in Virginia.

item.title: German chancellor slams Vance's call for Europe to be inclusive of far-right parties
item.description: Olaf Scholz rebuked U.S. Vice President JD Vance for suggesting that far-right parties should not be shut out of government. Germany's other political...

item.title: Base full of mouldy food and secret documents: Iranâ€™s rapid retreat from Syria
item.description: The BBC examines the chaos left behind after Iran had to abandon its military bases in Syria.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Raisins or not? Pudding debate splits island nation
item.description: The debate over a beloved dish has reignited as Antiguans and Barbudans seek to preserve their cultural heritage.

item.title: 2/15: CBS Weekend News
item.description: California crews clean up flooding and mudslides; Jannik Sinner gets 3-month ban for failing drug tests

item.title: What's it like to report from the Panama Canal?

item.title: Doctors order 'absolute rest' for Pope Francis due to respiratory infection
item.description: Doctors prescribed "absolute rest" for Pope Francis, the Vatican said Saturday, a day after the 88-year-old pope was admitted to a hospital following ...

item.title: Thousands of probationary federal health workers fired by letter this weekend

item.title: European leaders set to hold emergency summit on Ukraine
item.description: The UK PM, who is expected to attend, said it was a "once in a generation moment for our national security".

item.title: How Presidents Day has evolved from reverence to retail
EEOC seeks to drop gender discrimination case after Trump executive order
item.description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission moved to drop a suit on behalf of a worker allegedly fired for his sexual orientation and gender identity,...

item.title: Inside a family's fight to keep teen daughter's killers in prison

item.title: Why Uganda's iconic crested crane faces extinction
item.description: The population of the national bird is declining partly due to encroachment on wetlands by farmers.
